_header: They that without law do sin
_description: An extract of twenty-eight lines from the Pricke of Conscience (lines 6071-6113), occurring separately

BodRawC285.First Lines:
þai þat withoutene lawe dos syneWithoutene lawe sal perys
                    þar in…
BodRawC285.Last Lines:
…þe day of flaynge & grete affrayþe day of
                    partyng fra god foray
BodRawC285.Editions:
Horstmann,  Carl,
                        ed.  
             Yorkshire Writers.
         2 vols. London, Sonnenschein; New York: Macmillan, 1895-96: 1.129.

CULDd555.First Lines:
Þay þat withouten lawe dos synneWithoutyn lawe sal peris
                    þ[erynne]ffor at þat dedeful dome sothelySal al ilke aman
                    hafe þat he is Wurthy…
CULDd555.Last Lines:
…Þe day of flayinge & grete affrayeþe day of
                    parthynge fra god for ay
CULDd555.Editions:
Horstmann,  Carl,
                        ed.  
             Yorkshire Writers.
         2 vols. London, Sonnenschein; New York: Macmillan, 1895-96: 1.129.

CULFf540.First Lines:
Þei þat wiþoute lawe don synnewithoute lawe schul
                    persche þerynne…
CULFf540.Last Lines:
…The day of fleynge & gret affrayÞe day of partyng
                    from god for ay
CULFf540.Note: Written two lines of verse per line of manuscript.
